# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame, column_name::Symbol = :dt)
    transform(df, column_name => ByRow(dt -> year(dt) * 100 + month(dt)) => :ym)
end
```

This function `add_yearmonth` takes a `DataFrame` along with an optional `Symbol` argument specifying the name of the column from which to extract the year and month. It creates a new column `ym` representing year and month in the “yyyymm” format. It uses the `transform` function from the DataFrames.jl package along with the `ByRow` wrapper to apply the transformation per row.
